The Molecular Biophysics of Evolutionary and Physiological Adaptation

Griffin Chure | Ph.D. Thesis

Summary

The ability to adapt is central to the definition of 'Life'. Adaptation can be found across the biological scales, governing the nanosecond-scale conformational switching of proteins to millenia-long migrations. This website presents the text of my Ph.D. thesis in which I dissected adaptive processes at the molecular and organismal level. All research, unless otherwise stated, was performed at the California Institute of Technology under the guidance of Rob Phillips.
